ratings.comment: He is somehow not professional. He talked so many things unrelated to the course at any time in the lecture. He assigned a lot of homework but most of them are useless. The exams are extremely hard. I got every midterm and final better than average and I still got a BC at last. Do not take his stat310, for your own sake.
Best professor ever. Excited about the material, funny, helpful if you ask. Take a class with him if you can!
Bret is a great guy! He gives very clear explanations during lectures. The exams are not very difficult as long as you read the textbook and review your notes after class. Highly recommend.
Don't be late to class or he will stop lecturing to call you out. He's really passionate about statistics and his lectures are really engaging. I enjoy this class better than 309.
Bret is a great teacher and really cares about the material and helping you learn. However, the class is very, very difficult.

Stat310 is a very difficult course but I found Bret to be very helpful and overall a great professor. He writes extremely difficult tests, but sets a good curve. Clear explanations, great lecture notes, and it's easy to follow along as long as you actually study/review between lectures and try to follow along (which is expected in any math course)

This is probably one of the hardest classes in Statistics Department. It is true that Bret gives hard exams, but many of the questions come from notes. The most difficult part should be the fierce competition in the class. There will be a lot of talented Maths people! Prepare
Forgot what the subject I'm taking is at this point. Will take nothing away from this course of any value.

Bret is a very difficult person to talk to. He is fairly condescending while speaking to his students and does not present information in a digestible manner. I would say the textbook is the best resource. He often blames his students for a lack of trying rather than taking accountability for his poor teaching.

I find this guy highly irritating, and it's clear from his teaching style that he still has the mindset of grad student, regardless of his actual title. His ideas of what's "intuitive" and "so cool" are so completely baffling I have no idea what to even ask. I'm glad when I get sick and can't make it to class because it's that awful.

Bret is an awesome guy! Obviously really cares about the material and helping prepare you for further study in the field. Reading ahead and being prepared going into lectures will save you in this class. Do not recommend for those of you not interested in pursuing an education in statistics.

He really cares that his students actually learn something about statsprobability and not just show up and take exams. Lectures were enjoyable and interesting but could've been more useful if he spent less time rambling and more time on the course material. He's pretty generous with communicating what will be on exams and the curve is nice.

You're expected to learn material in depth before lecture.  Then during lecture it's all summary and concepts with a lot of tangents.  No details at all. He responds to questions and it's clear he cares, but doesn't teach stats on the same level we're learning it. Discussion and lecture slides are your best bet.
Bret is very energetic and loves statistics. He can sometimes go off topic but his lectures are overall pretty great. I loved attending this class and I would definitely recommend it to others.

Bret is great. Really into stats and he is always extremely helpful. He is also very practical in what he's teaching and is good at pointing out things that are actually useful in real world applications. The class wasn't super easy, but the curve was nice.

Bret is a great professor! He is very clear.  I think if I did not attend lecture, the material would be much more confusing - plus, he gives obvious hints about what will be on the exams during lecture. Exams were very fair and closely aligned with course material.

Pretty decent class, he is really into stats. He seems to care about the students and wow what a great curve. Do the homework attend lectures (not all the information is in the online postings) and you'll do fine.

Bret really cares a lot about his students and wants you to succeed.  I highly recommend going into his office hours as he has a great way to explain it using a white board, which is in his office space.  He'll make time to help just don't get behind!!!

Bret was an incredibly engaging and approachable professor. He truly strives for all students to understand statistics and its applications to biology, rather than just memorize and regurgitate equations. Exams and homework were fair, just be sure to attend lecture as he frequently highlights what to expect on exams! Overall, great class!

Bret was great!  He kept everything super relevant to biological applications of statistics, and really understandable.  Lectures were engaging.  Exams were fair, and homework counts toward your grade if you don't do well on exams.  If you have to take biostats, take it with Bret!
